questions.text: A child with loose stools for one day presented to your OPD. On examination, signs of dehydration were present and the child was given ORS. It facilitates glucose absorption through which of the following receptors?
Identify the type of transport across the cell membrane represented below?

In a patient with gastrointestinal symptoms, the dysfunction of which cellular structure, associated with the transmembrane protein Claudin, could potentially lead to altered permeability and paracellular transport?
In a patient, the hypothalamic thermostat was reset from point V to point X as shown below. Which of the following happens in stage W compared to stage Y?

Which of the following statements are correct regarding mechanisms of depolarisation, Repolarisation, and hyperpolarisation in a Nerve action potential?

 

  1. Depolarisation due to influx of Na+ through voltage-gated channels
  2. Depolarisation due to influx of Na+ through ligand-gated channels
  3. Repolarisation due to efflux of K+ through a voltage-gated channel
  4. Repolarisation due to efflux of K+ through a ligand-gated channel
  5. Hyperpolarisation due to slow closure of K+ channel
Which structures, equivalent to Z-lines in skeletal muscle, are found in smooth muscle cells?

Which of the following statements is true about cardiac muscle contraction?

 

  1. Extracellular Ca2+ is important for contraction 
  2. Ca2+ is released from mitochondria
  3. Ca2+ is released from the sarcoplasmic reticulum
  4. Ligand-gated Ca2+ channels on sarcolemma have no role in EC coupling

choices.text: Decreased end-systolic pressure and increased stroke volume
Shift of the loop upward and to the right with increased end-diastolic volume
Increased end-systolic pressure with decreased end-diastolic volume
Downward shift of the loop with increased compliance

questions.text: A 62-year-old man with longstanding uncontrolled hypertension presents with exertional dyspnea. Echocardiogram shows concentric left ventricular hypertrophy. Which of the following changes would most likely be observed in his left ventricular pressure-volume loop?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Increased end-systolic pressure with decreased end-diastolic volume

choices.text: Activation of carotid body chemoreceptors leads to the reflex condition.
Stimulation of aortic arch stretch receptors induces the reflex.
Chemical stimulation of left ventricular receptors triggers the reflex.
Peripheral vasodilation by direct action on vascular smooth muscle initiates the reflex.

questions.text: A 63-year-old male with a history of ischemic cardiomyopathy presents to the emergency department with acute onset of dizziness, marked hypotension, and bradycardia after taking an intravenous herbal supplement he found online. The emergency team, suspecting a potential reflex activation due to an unknown compound in the supplement, reminiscent of the effects seen with Veratrum alkaloids, which one of the following is true regarding the same reflex?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Chemical stimulation of left ventricular receptors triggers the reflex.

choices.text: A rightward shift of the curve indicates increased affinity of hemoglobin for oxygen, promoting loading of the oxygen loading on Hemoglobin.
Increased 2,3-DPG levels shift the dissociation curve to the left, enhancing oxygen binding.
Stored blood (banked blood) may show a left shift due to decreased levels of 2,3-DPG.
Hypothermia causes a right shift in the oxygen-hemoglobin dissociation curve.

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding the oxygen-hemoglobin dissociation curve are correct?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Stored blood (banked blood) may show a left shift due to decreased levels of 2,3-DPG.

questions.text: Which of the following neurons predominantly fire during forceful expiration?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Ventral group of neurons

choices.text: The change in the volume of the lungs with pressure is a measure of their compliance
The total compliance of the chest is determined solely by the compliance of the lungs
The recoil of the lungs assists inspiration
Pulmonary surfactant maintains a constant low surface tension in the alveoli

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true?
questions.solution: Ans. A) The change in the volume of the lungs with pressure is a measure of their compliance

questions.text: A 27-year-old man is breathing quietly. He then inhales as much air as possible and exhales as much air as he can, producing the spirogram shown in the figure. What is his expiratory reserve volume (in liters)?

A 65-year-old man with a 40-pack-year smoking history presents with progressive shortness of breath and chronic productive cough. He complains of exertional dyspnea that has worsened over the past year. Pulmonary function testing is performed, and his flow-volume loop (in blue color) is shown below. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis based on the flow-volume pattern and clinical findings?
questions.solution:
Ans. B) Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD)

 

The flow-volume loop shows a "scooped-out" or concave expiratory limb, characteristic of obstructive lung disease. Combined with the patient's age, smoking history, and chronic productive cough, COPD is the most likely diagnosis.

 

Other Options:

 

Option A. Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis: Would show a restrictive pattern with a narrow, tall loop, not a scooped expiratory limb.

 

Option C. Myasthenia gravis: Can affect respiratory muscles but typically causes a restrictive pattern with low volumes, not obstructive scooping.

 

Option D. Interstitial lung disease: Also shows a restrictive loop, not the obstructive pattern seen here.

choices.text: Occurs when Ia spindle afferents are inhibited.
Is a monosynaptic reflex initiated by activation of the Golgi tendon organ.
Is a disynaptic reflex with a single interneuron inserted between the afferent and efferent limbs.
Uses type II afferent fibers from the Golgi tendon organ

questions.text: Which one of the following statement accurately describes the a neurological phenomenon commonly observed in motor control and pivotal in maintaining appropriate muscle tension, involves a specific neuronal pathway with interneuronal processing between sensory and motor neurons, regulating muscle contraction by modulating motor neuron activity based on Golgi tendon organ input.
questions.solution: Ans. C) Is a disynaptic reflex with a single interneuron inserted between the afferent and efferent limbs.

questions.text: A 53-year-old male is brought to the emergency department with complains of right sided weakness and jargon speech. A CT brain was ordered to rule out haemorrhagic stroke. On neurological examination, there is normal object recognition but loss of comprehension. Which of the following areas is affected?

choices.text: Hair end organ and sustained pressure

questions.text: A 28-year-old man was seen by neurologist because he had experienced prolonged episodes of tingling and numbness in his right arm. He underwent a neurologic exam to evaluate his sensory nervous system. Which of the following cutaneous mechanoreceptors is correctly paired with the type of stimulus to which it is most apt to respond?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Pacinian corpuscle and rapid vibration

questions.text: What waves are shown as X & Y below:
A motorcyclist suffered head injury 6 months back and presents with persistent memory deficits following injury. Choose the most appropriately matched option related to memory?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Medial Temporal lobe - Declarative memory

choices.text: Growth hormone exerts most of its growth-promoting actions indirectly via somatomedins.
Somatomedin C, also known as IGF-2, is the most biologically important somatomedin in adults.
The half-life of IGF-1 is short compared to GH, similar to that of unbound peptide hormones.
Blood levels of IGF-1 do not correlate with GH levels due to their independent regulation.

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding the role of growth hormone (GH) and somatomedins is correct?
questions.solution:
Ans. A) Growth hormone exerts most of its growth-promoting actions indirectly via somatomedins.

 

GH stimulates the liver to produce somatomedins, particularly IGF-1, which mediate most of GH’s growth effects.

 

Other Options:

 

Option B. Somatomedin C, also known as IGF-2, is the most biologically important somatomedin in adults: Incorrect. Somatomedin C -IGF-1 (NOT IGF-2) is the most significant somatomedin responsible for skeletal and soft tissue growth in Adults.

 

Option C. The half-life of IGF-1 is short compared to GH, similar to that of unbound peptide hormones: Incorrect. IGF-1 binds to carrier proteins in blood, giving it a long half-life (~20 hours) unlike typical peptide hormones.

 

Option D. Blood levels of IGF-1 do not correlate with GH levels due to their independent regulation: Incorrect. Blood levels of IGF-1 generally parallel GH levels, as GH stimulates IGF-1 production in the liver.

questions.text: A 47-year-old male with a pituitary mass causing stalk compression is evaluated for hormonal imbalances. This condition often leads to altered secretion of various pituitary hormones. Which of the following hormones is least likely to have decreased secretion due to sectioning of the pituitary stalk?
Platelet derived growth factor acts through which one of the following pathway?

choices.text: Increased blood viscosity, and reduced renal blood flow
Increased plasma oncotic pressure reducing filtration fraction
Constriction of the efferent arteriole via angiotensin II
Increased renal sympathetic stimulation causing vasodilation of the afferent arteriole

questions.text: A 28-year-old male athlete is undergoing training at high altitude (4,000 meters) for a competitive event. After a week, he has polycythemia and an elevated hematocrit. However, his GFR is noted to be lower than baseline despite no signs of dehydration or hypotension. Which of the following is the most likely physiological mechanism responsible for the decreased GFR?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Increased blood viscosity, and reduced renal blood flow

questions.text: Vasopressin escape" in SIADH results due to:
questions.solution: Ans. A) Downregulation of aquaporin 2 production

questions.text: If Glomerular capillary hydrostatic pressure is 60mmHg, Bowman’s capsule hydrostatic pressure is 15 and glomerular oncotic pressure is 30 and bowman’s capsule oncotic pressure is 5 the net filtration pressure will be________ mmHg.

A 77-year-old man comes to the physician because of the swelling of his legs and feet for 6 months. He has a 40-year history of alcoholism and 5 year history of hepatic disease. Physical examination shows ascites and edema of the lower extremities. A decrease in which of the following most likely promotes edema formation in this patient?
questions.solution: Ans. D) Plasma colloid oncotic pressure

questions.text: A 45-year-old woman presents to the emergency department with a history of prolonged vomiting over the past 3 days. She complains of fatigue, muscle cramps, and lightheadedness. Vital signs reveal mild tachypnea. Arterial blood gas analysis shows a pH of 7.8, PaCO₂ of 50 mmHg, and HCO₃⁻ of 30 mEq/L. What is the most likely acid-base disturbance?
questions.solution: Ans. D) Metabolic alkalosis with respiratory compensation

choices.text: Histamine, which stimulates gastric acid production, potentially exacerbating ulcer symptoms.
Gastrin, which promotes mucus production and provides protection against ulcers.
Pepsinogen, an enzyme involved in protein digestion within the stomach.
Secretin, a hormone that regulates pancreatic enzyme secretion, influencing digestion.

questions.text: In a patient with chronic gastritis and peptic ulcer disease, it is important to understand the role of specific stomach cells. Which factor is primarily associated with enterochromaffin-like (ECL) cells of the stomach, and how does it contribute to the patient's condition?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Histamine, which stimulates gastric acid production, potentially exacerbating ulcer symptoms.

choices.text: Gastrin from G cells from stomach
Motilin from Mo cells from duodenum and jejunum
CCK from K cell of duodenum and pancreas
Secretin from S cells of duodenum and jejunum

questions.text: Which of the following is the incorrect match?
questions.solution: Ans. C) CCK from K cell of duodenum and pancreas

choices.text: It is secreted by S cells of intestine
It causes release of alkaline pancreatic juice rich in enzymes
Its action is mediated via intracellular cAMP

questions.text: All of the following are true about secretin except:
questions.solution: Ans. B) It causes release of alkaline pancreatic juice rich in enzymes

questions.text: A 10-year-old boy from Africa presents with a rapidly growing jaw mass. He is afebrile and otherwise healthy. Examination shows a firm, non-tender mandibular mass. Biopsy reveals a "starry sky" pattern on histology. Immunohistochemistry is positive for CD10, CD20, and Ki-67 >99%. Which of the following cytogenetic abnormalities is most characteristic of this condition?

choices.text: Hypoglycemia with increased serum insulin levels due to pancreatic islet tumor
Skin mucosal neuromas and marfanoid habitus
Hyperparathyroidism with elevated serum calcium and parathyroid adenoma

questions.text: A 28-year-old woman presents with episodic headaches, palpitations, and excessive sweating. She also had 2 surgeries for renal stones in last 18 months.  She also has a family history of thyroid carcinoma and renal tumors. MRI reveals a 4.5 cm adrenal mass. Genetic testing shows a RET proto-oncogene mutation. Which of the following additional findings is most likely in this patient?
questions.solution: Ans. D) Hyperparathyroidism with elevated serum calcium and parathyroid adenoma

questions.text: A 27-year-old girl has anemia, jaundice, splenomegaly and elevated LDH. Smear shows small, round RBCs without central pallor. Which is the likely diagnosis?

A 6-year-old boy presents with fatigue, fever, and bleeding gums. On examination, he has pallor, petechiae, and generalized lymphadenopathy. CBC reveals pancytopenia and blast cells. Flow cytometry shows positivity for TdT, CD10, and CD19. Cytogenetic analysis reveals t(12;21). Which of the following is most associated with a favorable prognosis in this child?

choices.text: TNF-alpha increases thermoregulatory set point indirectly
IL-1 stimulates the hypothalamus to produce prostaglandins
IL-6 induces PGE2 synthesis in the hypothalamus

questions.text: Which of the following statements about fever is not true?
questions.solution: Ans. D) PGE2 inhibits heat generation

questions.text: A 30-year-old woman has hematuria, red cell casts, tests positive for anti-nuclear antibody and has wire-loop lesions in renal biopsy as shown. What is her likely diagnosis?

A 28-year-old woman presents with fatigue, pallor, and cravings for ice. Labs show Hb 9.1 g/dL and microcytic hypochromic RBCs. Which of the following best distinguishes iron deficiency anemia from anemia of chronic disease?
A 50-year-old silicosis patient develops massive hemoptysis. Which infection is he predisposed to?

choices.text: Chronic inflammation and mucus gland hypertrophy leading to airway obstruction
Increased airway smooth muscle contraction and bronchospasm
Excessive thickening of the alveolar walls and impaired gas exchange
Bronchial wall fibrosis and irreversible dilation of bronchi

questions.text: A 65-year-old male with a history of 30 pack-years of smoking presents with chronic cough, copious sputum production, and dyspnea. Chest examination reveals wheezes and prolonged expiration. HRCT shows tram tracking as shown. What is the underlying pathophysiology?
questions.solution: Ans. D) Bronchial wall fibrosis and irreversible dilation of bronchi

questions.text: A 38-year-old vegan woman presents with fatigue, glossitis, and numbness in her feet. Labs reveal macrocytic anemia with hypersegmented neutrophils. Which of the following is most specific for vitamin B12 deficiency?
A HIV-positive man has violaceous skin nodules. Biopsy shows spindle cells, slit-like vessels, HHV-8+. Diagnosis?
A patient develops hypotension, back pain, and hemoglobinuria within 30 minutes of a transfusion. Which of the following is the most likely reason?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Acute hemolytic transfusion reaction

questions.text: A 50-year-old male presents with fatigue, weight loss, and splenomegaly. Complete blood count shows leukocytosis with basophilia and eosinophilia. Which finding best distinguishes CML from a leukemoid reaction?
questions.solution: Ans. C) High leukocyte alkaline phosphatase (LAP) score

questions.text: A 40-year-old man presents with dry cough, hilar lymphadenopathy, and elevated ACE. Biopsy is non-caseating granulomas. The likely diagnosis is:
A woman presents with a thyroid nodule. FNAC shows empty-appearing nuclei and psammoma bodies. Most likely?

A patient present with mucocutaneous bleeding and prolonged bleeding time. Platelet aggregation studies reveal normal response to ADP, epinephrine, and collagen, but absent response to ristocetin, which gets corrected with normal plasma. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 52-year-old woman presents with a palpable lump in her left breast with bloody nipple discharge. A core needle biopsy is performed, and histopathology reveals sheets of small, pleomorphic cells infiltrating the stroma with the formation of glandular structures. Which of the following is not true for her?

 

 

  1. Diamino benzidine is used for brown color in IHC.
  2. For a score 3 in IHC, Fluorescence in situ hybridization is indicated.
  3. Increased cadherin expression makes breast cancer bilateral and multifocal.
  4. Underactivity of CDH1 gene is associated with familial gastric cancer

A 50-year-old man presents with complaints of joint pain, fatigue, and darkening of his skin. He has also been recently diagnosed with diabetes mellitus. On examination, his liver is enlarged and there is hyperpigmentation of the skin, particularly on sun-exposed areas. Lab investigations reveal: Serum iron: Elevated, Transferrin saturation: Elevated, Serum ferritin: Elevated, Total Iron Binding Capacity (TIBC): Decreased and fasting blood glucose is 168 mg/dL. Which of the following complications is this patient most at risk of developing if left untreated?

choices.text: Autoimmune destruction of gastric parietal cells leading to B12 malabsorption
Autoimmune response triggered by gliadin leading to small intestinal mucosal damage
Loss of brush-border enzymes leading to osmotic diarrhea from disaccharides
Inflammatory bowel disease with transmural granulomatous inflammation

questions.text: A 26-year-old woman presents with chronic diarrhea, bloating, and weight loss over 6 months. She also reports fatigue and occasional tingling in her feet. Examination reveals pallor and angular cheilitis. Lab investigations show: Hemoglobin: 8.7 g/dL, MCV: 104 fL (↑), Serum iron: Low, Serum folate: Low and positive anti-tissue transglutaminase (anti-tTG). The duodenal biopsy shows villous atrophy, crypt hyperplasia and increased intraepithelial lymphocytes. Which of the following best explains the pathophysiology of this patient’s condition?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Autoimmune response triggered by gliadin leading to small intestinal mucosal damage

choices.text: Sterile vegetations composed of fibrin and platelets on both sides of the valve
Fibrin-rich thrombi with bacterial colonies and inflammatory cells
Sterile vegetations composed of fibrin and platelets along line of closure
Vegetations composed entirely of eosinophilic hyaline material without inflammatory cells

questions.text: A 32-year-old intravenous drug user presents with fever, fatigue, and breathlessness. On examination, he has a new holosystolic murmur best heard at the lower left sternal border, splinter hemorrhages, and Janeway lesions. Blood cultures grow Staphylococcus aureus. Transthoracic echocardiography shows mobile vegetations on the tricuspid valve. Which of the following best describes the pathological features of the vegetations seen in this condition?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Fibrin-rich thrombi with bacterial colonies and inflammatory cells

questions.text: Analyse the image of chromosome 15 provided along and answer which of the following is the likely diagnosis in the patient?
A 6-year-old boy develops periorbital swelling and dark-colored urine 1 week after a skin infection. Which feature best differentiates PSGN from IgA nephropathy?

A 45-year-old man presents with persistent nasal congestion, hematuria, and hemoptysis. He reports recurrent sinus infections and weight loss over the past 3 months. On examination, he has nasal septal perforation and bilateral crackles on lung auscultation. Urinalysis shows proteinuria and red blood cell casts. Chest X-ray reveals multiple bilateral lung nodules with cavitation. Which of the following is most specific for confirming the diagnosis in this patient?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Positive c-ANCA directed against proteinase-3

questions.text: A 50-year-old man presents with episodes of flushing, watery diarrhea, and wheezing. He has no known allergies. CT abdomen shows a well-defined mass in the ileum with multiple liver metastases. Urinary 5-HIAA is elevated. Which of the following additional findings is most likely to be present in this patient?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Right-sided valvular heart lesions

choices.text: Anaerobic glycolysis due to mitochondrial failure
Increased lactate production under aerobic conditions
Enhanced ketogenesis due to insulin resistance

questions.text: A 62-year-old man with a history of lung cancer undergoes a PET scan for staging. The scan shows increased uptake of fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) in multiple lymph nodes. Which of the following best explains the metabolic basis for this observation?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Increased lactate production under aerobic conditions
